content.description: Follow large quartz jugs and an easy right hand arete to the top.
content.protection: pad, and spotter. If the climber fell awkwardly/unexpectedly they could fall left and hit the boulder behind the route.
content.location: right side of the north face. Obvious big boulder which has Five Alive on the east face.

content.description: Begin on the chalked holds near the arete, then make a left-ward reach to a nice side-pull. Work up the arete with the right hand and delicately stand to reach the lip. Easy and fun top-out.
content.protection: Extremely flat landing...this could be done safely with only a spotter or a pad.
content.location: up the right side of the east face. tall, beautiful, obvious. the face is visible from most campsites.

content.description: Start on the east face of the boulder. Begin on small crimps and head straight up avoiding the arete on the right. Crystal pinch high with bad feet and throw for the lip. Fun problem and helps if your tall!

The Five Alive Boulder is one of the first block you encounter when entering the area. Can be seen from the parking lot. Most parties walk right past this block on the way into the heart of the Trash Can Boulders. The arete and the East face have great problems that utilize sharp crystals. The North face hosts a great warm up on the right side of the face/arete.
